intro: Memecylon grande, commonly known as the large memecylon, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other economically important trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in axillary inflorescences. It produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, and it is often found in moist, shaded habitats within lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
